\93We needed unbounded patience, for the scoffers were many. We were frequently greeted by scornful allusions to our former disappointment. \91You have not gone up yet; when do you expect to go up?\92 and similar sarcasms were often vented upon us by our worldly acquaintances, and even by some professed Christians, who accepted the Bible yet failed to learn its great and important truths. Their blinded eyes seemed to see but a vague and distant meaning in the solemn warning, \91God hath appointed a day in the which he will judge the 
188
world,\92 and in the assurance that the saints will be caught up together to meet the Lord in the air.
